com.percussion.cms.objectstore.server
Class PSServerItem

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSDbComponent
      com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSItemComponent
          com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSCoreItem
              com.percussion.cms.objectstore.server.PSServerItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSCmsComponent, IPSDbComponent, IPSItemAccessor, com.percussion.cms.objectstore.server.IPSPersister, Cloneable
public class PSServerItem
extends PSCoreItem
implements com.percussion.cms.objectstore.server.IPSPersister

A PSCoreItem that is Rhythmyx server aware. Meaning it can persist itself to the system.

Field Detail

TYPE_BINARY

public static final int TYPE_BINARY
Flag to indicate binary fields should be loaded. Binary field values will only be loaded if this flag is included. If not loaded, item may be saved without affecting these field values. Also, if not loaded, new binary field values may be set, but existing values cannot be retrieved from the server. If loaded, data is not actually retrieved from the server until the value is requested from the PSBinaryValue object.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

TYPE_FIELDS

public static final int TYPE_FIELDS
Flag to indicate fields should be loaded. Absence of this flag means that no field values will be loaded, even if TYPE_BINARY is also specified. If not loaded, item may still be saved without affecting any field values. TODO: This flag is not yet supported

See Also:
Constant Field Values

TYPE_CHILD

public static final int TYPE_CHILD
Flag to indicate if child items should be loaded. If not loaded, new child items may still be added and saved without affecting any existing child items.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

TYPE_RELATED

public static final int TYPE_RELATED
Flag to indicate if the relationships of the related items should be loaded. If not loaded, new item relationships may still be added and saved without affecting any existing item relationships.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

TYPE_RELATED_ITEM

public static final int TYPE_RELATED_ITEM
Flag to indicate if the related (or dependent) items of the relationships should be loaded. This has to be used in conjunction with is on. If both TYPE_RELATED and this flag are on, then load the relationships as well as the related items of the relationships.

Loading related items is an expensive operation and should be avoid if is not needed. The loaded items contain non-binary fields and child entries, but do not contain binary fields and the AA relationships with their dependent items. In other words, the related items are load with TYPE_FIELDS and TYPE_CHILD flags on, but the other TYPE_XXX flags are off.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

PSServerItem

public PSServerItem(PSItemDefinition itemDefinition)
             throws PSCmsException
Construct a new object from the definition, default field values will not be provided.

Parameters:
itemDefinition - must not be null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied itemDefinition is null.
PSCmsException - - if an extraction error occurs while the definition is being extracted.

PSServerItem

public PSServerItem(PSItemDefinition itemDef,
                    PSLocator itemId,
                    PSSecurityToken tok)
             throws PSCmsException,
                    com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSInvalidContentTypeException
Constructs and loads this item in one step. See load(PSLocator, PSRequest) for important information. Resulting item data will not include binary field values.

Parameters:
itemDef - Defines the content type this item will represent. May not be null.
itemId - The locator of the item to load, may be null to load an item's default field values.
tok - Used to determine access to the item. May not be null.
Throws:
SecurityException - if the user is not authorized.
PSCmsException - if error occurs processing the item definition or loading the item.
com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSInvalidContentTypeException - if content type specified by the item def is invalid.

PSServerItem

public PSServerItem(PSItemDefinition itemDef,
                    PSLocator itemId,
                    PSSecurityToken tok,
                    int loadFlags)
             throws PSCmsException,
                    com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSInvalidContentTypeException
Constructs and loads this item in one step. Same as PSServerItem(PSItemDefinition, PSLocator, PSSecurityToken) with an extra param that controls what type of data is loaded. Only the extra parameter is described below, see that method for other parameter and exception information.

Parameters:
loadFlags - Flags to indicate what types of data should be loaded. Any of the TYPE_XXX flags Or'd together.
Throws:
PSCmsException
com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSInvalidContentTypeException

Method Detail

loadItem

public static PSServerItem loadItem(PSLocator itemId,
                                    PSSecurityToken tok)
                             throws PSCmsException,
                                    com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSInvalidContentTypeException
Factory method that obtains the appropriate item def for the item referenced by the supplied locator and then constructs and returns an instance of this class representing that item. The resulting item will not include binary field data.

Parameters:
itemId - The locator of the item to load, may not be null.
tok - Used to determine access to the item. May not be null.
Returns:
The item, never null.
Throws:
SecurityException - if the supplied token does not allow access.
PSCmsException - if error occurs loading the item.
com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSInvalidContentTypeException - if the supplied item id is not valid.

                 com.percussion.server.PSRequest request,

load

public void load(PSLocator itemId,
                 com.percussion.server.PSRequest request,
                 int loadFlags,
                 int communityId)
          throws PSCmsException,
                 com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSInvalidContentTypeException
Loads this item from the storage component. This will populate the item with definition and data.

Parameters:
itemId - the item locator. May be null to load an items defaults.
request - the original request that prompted this update/insert, not null.
loadFlags - flags to indicate what types of data should be loaded. Any of the TYPE_XXX flags Or'd together.
communityId - the community id to filter by, -1 to ignore this filter.
Throws:
PSCmsException - if an error loading the item occurs.
com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSInvalidContentTypeException - if the content type is invalid.

createChildEntry

public PSItemChildEntry createChildEntry(com.percussion.server.PSRequest request,
                                         String name)
                                  throws PSCmsException,
                                         com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException,
                                         com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSInvalidChildTypeException
Create new child entry for the specified child name that includes default field values by making a new request to the child editor page.

Parameters:
request - The request to use, may not be null.
name - The child name, may not be null and must be an existing child.
Returns:
The entry, never null, will not have been added to this item.
Throws:
PSCmsException - if there are any errors.
com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException - If the requested child editor is doc is malformed.
com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSInvalidChildTypeException - If the specified child name is invalid.

Specified by:
save in interface com.percussion.cms.objectstore.server.IPSPersister
Throws:
PSCmsException

save

public void save(com.percussion.server.PSRequest request,
                 int communityId)
          throws PSCmsException
Once a standard item object has been created use this function to update the data for that item on the server. For an update, this function assumes that we have a full standard item with all the fields.

Parameters:
request - the request used to execute the save request.
communityId - the community for which to save the item, -1 to ignore the community.
Throws:
PSCmsException - if there is any problem saving the item.

getKey

public PSLocator getKey()
Returns the PSLocator object of this item. This is useful for new items being persisted. This will then have the PSLocator object with the new content id and revision.

Returns:
a locator of the current content item
